title: Ex-president Hollande's 2027 presidential election comeback is fraught with obstacles
subhed: Once dismissed as far-fetched just a few months ago, former Socialist president François Hollande's candidacy is now seen as a credible scenario. However, he must face several obstacles within both the broader left and his Socialist party.
byline: By Olivier Pérou and Sandrine Cassini

title: Trump revokes key climate finding, dismantling legal basis for emissions rules
Italian PM Meloni visits Ethiopia and confirms her ambitions in Africa
French people exposed to 'concerning' levels of cadmium, lead and aluminum through food
subhed: Reviewing more than 700 samples representing 90% of the French diet, the national health agency released its third 'total diet study' assessing exposure to toxic substances through food.

title: Storm Nils kills three in France and Spain
subhed: Around 450,000 households were without electricity on Friday after the storm tore through southern France. Portugal was also hit.

title: For Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron, Olympic gold at Milan 2026 is a 'goal achieved' after much 'uncertainty'
subhed: In an interview with Le Monde, the French pair who won the gold medal in ice dance on Wednesday reflect on their performance and meticulous preparation for the event.
byline: Interview by Maryline Baumard (Milan (Italy) special correspondent)

title: NATO shake-up fails to boost France's influence within the alliance
subhed: Despite Paris's hopes, the reorganization of the North Atlantic Alliance, finalized on February 6, does not allow France to increase its weight within the organization. Meanwhile, Germany is aiming for the key post of chair of the military committee.
byline: By Elise Vincent, Chloé Hoorman and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: UK high court upholds activist group Palestine Action's challenge against government ban

byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

Ice hockey at the 2026 Olympics: A mountain sport looks to win over France's big cities
subhed: The majority of players on the French national team hail from urban centers. This shift reflects the changing landscape of the sport across the country.

title: Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhed: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhed: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.
